description.narrative: Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Kärnstöd till International Legal Assistance Consortium (ILAC) - en nätverksorganisation, med sekretariat i Sverige, för sammanslutningar av professioner inom rättsområdet på nationell eller internationell nivå. ILAC arbetar för förebyggande av återfall i konflikt genom stöd till återuppbyggnad av oberoende rättssystem och samhällen byggda på rättsstatens principer. Stödet innebär kärnstöd till ILAC, som också bedriver program finansierade av andra Sidaenheter respektive utlandsmyndigheter. Kärnstödet ger ILAC flexibilitet och möjlighet att svara upp mot behov och efterfrågan på bland annat fördjupade analyser av rättsystem i konflikt eller post-konfliktskeden samt att påverka och bidra till policyutveckling inom stöd till rättsstatsuppbyggnad i konfliktkontexter. I stödet omfattas också medel för ett specifikt utbytesprojekt mellan tunisiska och palestinska aktörer inom rättsväsendena för att möjliggöra delande av erfarenheter från den tunisiska reformprocessen med de palestinska aktörerna.

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 Core support to ILAC - a network of fifty organisations working on rehabilitation of justice systems in and after conflict. ILAC is running Sida-funded programs and this core support allows ILAC to remain flexible and apt to resopnd to needs for, amongst others, country specific analyses of justice systems and to formulate recommendations for national and international actors to align with. ILAC also works to influence on policy development in the area of justice systems in conflict-affected countries. Sida includes, in the core support, funding for a specific exchange exercise between Tunisian and Palestinian representatives for the justice systems on management of tensions between secular and islamist groups and standpoints.

The ILAC Strategic Plan for 2017-2021 contains three objectives:
1. The capacity of justice sector institutions, bar associations and their members to address public demands for accountability and justice in accordance with international standards, is enhanced.
2. International policy and practice in rule of law reform has been influenced.
3. Internal ILAC systems and capacities for demand-driven, flexible and coherent operations are further developed, and synergies within the membership to better capitalise on cutting-edge expertise are improved.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 10.3 - Ensure equal opportunity and reduce inequalities of outcome, including by eliminating discriminatory laws, policies and practices and promoting appropriate legislation, policies and action in this regard.

10.3 - Säkerställa lika möjligheter och minska förekomsten av ojämlika utfall, bland annat genom att avskaffa diskriminerande lagstiftning, politik och praxis och främja lagstiftning, politik och åtgärder av lämpligt slag i detta hänseende.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.2 - Eliminera övergrepp, utnyttjande, människohandel och alla former av våld eller tortyr mot barn.
16.2 - End abuse, exploitation, trafficking and all forms of violence against and torture of children.
16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.
16.5 - Substantially reduce corruption and bribery in all their forms.
16.5 - Väsentligt minska alla former av korruption och mutor.
16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

5.a - Genomföra reformer för att ge kvinnor lika rätt till ekonomiska resurser, möjlighet att äga och kontrollera mark och andra former av egendom samt tillgång till finansiella tjänster, arv och naturresurser, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning

5.a - Undertake reforms to give women equal rights to economic resources, as well as access to ownership and control over land and other forms of property, financial services, inheritance and natural resources, in accordance with national laws.

description.narrative:
Key results from the current agreement period are developed in more detail in Annex 2 to ILAC's extension application (Document 043042/21 in Dox), but include:
- An assessment and follow-up assessment, as well as several policy briefs, on the Rule of Law in Guatemala that have informed policies and programming among both national and international actors. - Assessment of the administrative tribunal of Tunisia that was used for national reforms and to develop international support to the national efforts. - In MENA, over 1,800 Tunisian judges have increased their knowledge of judicial independence, and associations of women judges have formally been established in Tunisia and Morocco. Human rights education methodology has been officially integrated in the curricula at judicial training institutions in four countries and in Libya, legal professionals have documented and reported on human rights violations. - 200 Syrian legal professionals have enhanced their knowledge and capacity on international human rights standards, including on housing and property rights. Almost 1,500 criminally accused have been provided with legal protection services and pro-bono lawyers have provided around 2,000 legal consultations for people in vulnerable situation. - In Cuba legal knowledge and awareness of some 250 lawyers (25% of all the lawyers in the country) have increased and four pilot projects on Clinical Legal Education at the University of Havana have been developed.
ILAC has also become a member of the Justice Task Force of the Pathfinders for Peaceful, Just and Inclusive Societies initiative. The external evaluation of ILACs core support carried out in 2020/21, stated that ILAC makes a valuable contribution to SDG 16 and other SDGs, including goal 5 on gender equality.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
